description: Erection of single storey rear extension (3.8m in depth, maximum height of 3.0m and eaves height of 3.0m) following demolition of existing conservatory extension
decision_conditions: Paragraph 14 of the The Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) Regulations 2012 (as amended) requires a fee of Â£96, payable for all notifications of larger home extension applications.The applicant has not paid the requisite fee and as such the application is hereby refused.

Condition A.4. (7) of (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 states that where an owner or occupier of any adjoining premises objects to the proposed development, the prior approval of the local planning authority is required as to the impact of the proposed development on the amenity of any adjoining premises.

There are issues with the following submitted documents as follows:Plan 130505-D-353 - inconsistency. The plan Title refers to 'Proposed' and drawing label refers to 'Existing'The Planning Statement refers to a different address to the Site AddressThe Design and Access Statement refers to a different address to the Site AddressPlease review these issues, amend where necessary and re-submit the documents.Please submit any amendments to this application to the Development Management e-mail address quoted at the top of this letter, or via post, addressed to Development Management.Note: Amendments or revised drawings should not be resubmitted through the Planning Portal.
